snippet: Liberal Democrats and their coalition partner could control both houses, ending what is known here as a “twisted Parliament” that has added to Japan’s recent political paralysis.
abstract: Opinion polls show Japanese Prime Min Shinzo Abe's ruling Liberal Democratic Party heading for a big victory in elections for upper house of Parliament, possibly giving him stronger control of Japan's long-fractured political landscape than any leader in almost a decade.
lead_paragraph: Liberal Democrats and their coalition partner could control both houses, ending what is known here as a “twisted Parliament” that has added to Japan’s recent political paralysis.

headline.main: Party of Japan’s Premier Poised for Big Election Win
headline.print_headline: Party of Japan’s Premier Poised for Big Election Win
